Yes, this release does work.  You have to use a Steam unpacking program, and then it runs perfect.

From the comments section at demonoid: 

codix1  - "Works fine for me.

Just update Phoenix 1.4. Once you do so, close the program, re-open it and do the following:

Click 'Instruments' -> Update ContentDescriptionRecord -> Mouse over and client 'Internet'

Allow it to do its thing.

Once it has completed, select:

Click 'Instruments' -> SID Unpacker

Here you browse for the SIM file. Once select, click select all, then unpack.

Make a folder on your Desktop called 'Fallout' and observe the unpacking. Once you update your CDR directory, it also rids itself of a progress bar. It'll take a good 10-15 minutes to unpack and once it does, /everything/ will be unpacked into that folder. You can use the SKIDROW cracks to run the game. It runs flawlessly after this, just kinda messy.

Hope this helps."

codix1 from demonoid:
Works fine for me.

Just update Phoenix 1.4. Once you do so, close the program, re-open it and do the following:

Click 'Instruments' -> Update ContentDescriptionRecord -> Mouse over and client 'Internet'

Allow it to do its thing.

Once it has completed, select:

Click 'Instruments' -> SID Unpacker

Here you browse for the SIM file. Once select, click select all, then unpack.

Make a folder on your Desktop called 'Fallout' and observe the unpacking. Once you update your CDR directory, it also rids itself of a progress bar. It'll take a good 10-15 minutes to unpack and once it does, /everything/ will be unpacked into that folder. You can use the SKIDROW cracks to run the game. It runs flawlessly after this, just kinda messy.

Hope this helps.
Thank you ;)
